main event: The document contains multiple UFO sightings near Orly AF France in 1956, including reports from a C-119 aircraft crew and airport workers, as well as radar observations.
interesting points: The UFO sighting involved a round dot, similar in size to a star, that changed color from white to reddish orange and back, and was initially thought to be an aircraft navigation light.
The object was estimated to be 10-20 miles away and was observed by a C-119 aircraft crew near Marseille, France, at 2000 ft MSL.

Radar operators at Orly International Airport also picked up metallic objects moving at incredible speeds, estimated to be around 1,200 miles per hour, beyond the capacity of the fastest jets to intercept.

A newspaper article described sightings of a mysterious object traveling at approximately 1,500 miles per hour, appearing twice as large as an ordinary commercial airliner, and changing color from orange to white.

French fighter plane pilots reported chasing a mysterious object for four hours, describing it as a flattened sphere or 'cognac bottle' that changed color and reached speeds of up to 2,000 miles per hour.
sighted object: round dot resembling a star, changing from white to reddish orange
witnesses: airport workers, C-119 aircraft crew, radar operators, French fighter plane pilots
